body:
> Linux portability PR only checks if the tests build correctly

This is kind of misleading. We have a test job called Linux portability Master, and another test job called Linux portability PR, and they test different things.
I agree. Any suggestions how to improve? We don't have the capacity to run all the portability tests on each PR (hence the --build_only)
If we don't have the resources to run the tests, I would prefer to at least have a different name for the job to indicate that it doesn't run the tests. Maybe "Linux build portability PR"

I ran these tests on my own machine, and as far as I can tell, every single one ended with these messages in the trace:

```
E0428 10:43:10.351481794   28998 cq_verifier.c:273]          cq returned unexpected event: OP_COMPLETE: tag:0x1 OK
E0428 10:43:10.351502779   28998 cq_verifier.c:280]          expected tags:
0x65 GRPC_OP_COMPLETE result=1 test/core/end2end/tests/invoke_large_request.c:200
```

CC @ctiller Does that output mean anything in particular to you?

Ping on the issue. Stacktrace from `c_linux_dbg_uv.bins/dbg/h2_fakesec_test simple_request`:
```
D0623 13:17:02.647415068   17262 test_config.c:388]          test slowdown factor: sanitizer=1, fixture=1, poller=1, total=1
```
